description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer is set to announce plans for a “digital revolution” to reshape the British state, saying that digitizing public services and harnessing artificial intelligence could unlock £45 billion ($58 billion) in annual productivity savings.
title: Starmer Sees £45 Billion Savings in UK Push Into Digital, AI

description: After US President Donald Trump imposed global tariffs on steel and aluminum, Canada on Wednesday revealed a list of retaliatory duties that apply to C$29.8 billion ($20.7 billion) of American goods — including ones used for Trump’s favorite pastime.
title: Canada’s $21 Billion Counter-Tariffs Span Metals to Golf Balls

description: Today on the Big Take podcast: As a peace deal comes into focus, some Western investors are eager to do business in Russia. But there are big risks.
title: Investors Make Risky Bet on Russia's Return to Financial Markets

description: Steve Witkoff, a long-time Trump confidant and fellow Manhattan real estate mogul, is taking center stage in some of America’s biggest geopolitical negotiations.
title: Trump’s Go-To Broker Brings NYC-Style Dealmaking to a World on Edge

description: New Zealand’s prime minister pitched his country as a safe haven in an unstable world as he opened an Investor Summit aimed at attracting foreign capital.
title: New Zealand Pitches Itself as Safe Haven in ‘Global Storm’

description: President Donald Trump’s push to hollow out the Education Department this week sparked fresh angst among student borrowers, raising concern about what happens to them and the more than one trillion dollars in debt they have to collectively repay.
title: ‘Freaking the Hell Out:’ Education Overhaul Rattles Student Loan Borrowers

description: It's a massive geopolitical gamble that could yet backfire.
title: Global Investors Make a Risky Bet on Russia’s Return to Markets

description: The UK and France are scrambling to bolster Ukraine’s negotiating position as US President Donald Trump seeks to force through a settlement in its war with Russia.
title: UK and France Race to Draft Ukraine Troops Plan Trump Will Buy

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior writer for economics Shawn Donnan looks at the context of the president’s drive to cut the government. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump and Musk on Austerity Drive That Would Outdo Thatcher

description: Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer said his party will block a Republican spending bill to avert a government shutdown on Saturday and urged the GOP to accept a Democratic plan to provide 30 days of interim funding instead.
title: Schumer Says Democrats Will Block GOP Plan to Avert Shutdown

description: Bryan Bedford, the chief executive officer of regional airline Republic Airways Holdings Inc., is the frontrunner to be the next leader of the US Federal Aviation Administration, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Republic Airways CEO Leads Candidates for FAA Top Post

description: The Department of Education is facing a reckoning under US President Donald Trump.
title: What’s at Stake as Trump Targets the Education Department

description: The US Federal Trade Commission is moving ahead with a sprawling antitrust probe of Microsoft Corp. that was opened in the waning days of the Biden Administration, signaling that Donald Trump’s new FTC Chair Andrew Ferguson is going to prioritize scrutiny of tech giants.
title: Trump’s FTC Moves Ahead With Broad Microsoft Antitrust Probe

description: France’s economic outlook has deteriorated as the anticipated impact of a global trade war compounds an already slow start to the year, the country’s central bank said.
title: France’s Growth Outlook Fades as Trump’s Trade War Weighs

description: UK carbon futures jumped on Wednesday after a Treasury minister said the government would consider linking the country’s emissions market to the European Union’s system.
title: UK Carbon Prices Surge as Minister Talks About EU Market Linkage

description: The UK government will force employers in the care sector to hire migrant workers already in Britain before they can recruit from abroad, in its latest attempt to bring down the huge number of people arriving in the country through legal routes.
title: UK Restricts Overseas Care Hiring in Drive to Reduce Migration

description: The UK said it’s revoking accreditation for a Russian diplomat and a diplomatic spouse in retaliation against Moscow’s expulsion of two Britons earlier in the week.
title: UK Spat With Russia Escalates Over British Diplomat’s Expulsion

description: Mexico is delaying its response to US tariffs on steel and aluminum imports as President Claudia Sheinbaum avoids retaliation while both countries negotiate to avert levies on a wide range of products and services.
title: Mexico Holds Off Tariff Retaliation as Sheinbaum Bets on US Deal

description: The US Federal Trade Commission is asking a federal judge to delay a trial challenging Amazon.com Inc.’s Prime subscription practices, citing “severe” resource constraints at the agency.
title: FTC Seeks Delay in Amazon Prime Case Over Resource Constraints

description: A plane believed to be carrying Rodrigo Duterte arrived in the Netherlands on Wednesday, as the former Philippine President prepared to face International Criminal Court charges for alleged crimes against humanity during his deadly war on drugs.
title: Plane Carrying Duterte Lands in Netherlands After ICC Arrest

description: The EU will pledge funds to help with reconstruction in Syria at a donors conference it’s hosting next week, the bloc’s commissioner for the Mediterranean said, as officials continue to evaluate the interim regime that holds power in Damascus.
title: EU Ready to Support Syria, Gaza Reconstruction, Official Says

description: Guyana President Irfaan Ali is exploring a partnership with Suriname to build a gas-powered industrial hub as he works to fortify his nation’s economy, which was rapidly transformed by oil fortunes in the past decade.
title: Guyana Seeks Suriname Gas Deal After Building Oil Fortune

description: Guyana President Irfaan Ali is exploring a partnership with Suriname to build a gas-powered industrial hub as he works to fortify his nation’s economy, which was rapidly transformed by oil fortunes in the past decade.
title: Guyana Seeks Suriname Gas Deal After Building Oil Fortune

description: US President Donald Trump assailed what he cast as imbalances in global trade during a meeting with Irish Prime Minister Micheál Martin, reiterating his threat to impose reciprocal tariffs on other nations.
title: Trump Bemoans Trade Deficits, Pines for Ireland’s Tax Breaks

description: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said US President Donald Trump’s calls for negotiations with the Islamic Republic are a ploy that will lead to tighter sanctions on his country’s economy.
title: Iran’s Khamenei Says Talks With Trump Will Lead to More Sanctions

description: Greenland is set to start talks on building a coalition after voters backed a slower path to independence, spurning US President Donald Trump’s approaches.
title: Greenland to Kick Off Coalition Talks After Voters Snub Trump

description: The White House asked a federal judge to deny the Associated Press’s request to restore access for its reporters, arguing that the First Amendment doesn’t preclude government officials from favoring particular journalists.
title: White House Defends Banning AP, Says Trump Has Wide Discretion

description: President Donald Trump is slated to meet with Republican members of the Senate Finance Committee, the panel responsible for crafting the multi-trillion tax cut bill Congress is aiming to pass this year, according to a person familiar with the plan.
title: Trump to Meet With Senate Finance Panel as Tax Talks Heat Up

description: Democrats have a rare moment of leverage in Washington after losing the November election and watching helplessly as Elon Musk dismantles the federal government.
title: Senate Democrats in Political Bind as Republicans Dare Them on US Shutdown

description: As Republican lawmakers seek to impeach judges for slowing President Donald Trump’s agenda, two leaders of the US judiciary issued rare public remarks condemning those actions as threats to the independence of judges.
title: Veteran Federal Judges Hit Back at GOP Calls for Impeachment

description: New Hampshire Senator Jeanne Shaheen will not run for reelection in 2026, opening up a competitive seat and complicating Democrats’ efforts to reclaim the Senate majority.
title: Shaheen’s Retirement Opens Competitive Senate Seat in 2026

description: Prime Minister Viktor Orban extended lifetime income tax exemptions for mothers in a bid to narrow his challenger’s lead in popular support, with a little over a year to go before the next election.
title: Orban Extends Tax Cuts to Close Challenger’s Lead in Hungary

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin will probably agree to eventual truce terms with Ukraine but wants his own conditions met beforehand, likely dragging out the negotiations.
title: Putin Likely to Drag Out Ukraine Truce Talks to Seek Terms

description: The Rwanda-backed M23 rebel group has consolidated control over the two largest cities in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, effectively setting up a proto-state in the mineral-rich region and forcibly recruiting soldiers and civilians.
title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Dig In by Recruiting Civilians in Congo

description: The Trump administration is employing a little-used immigration provision to try to deport a Palestinian activist with permanent residency status in the US.
title: Trump Uses Rare Provision in Bid to Deport Palestinian Activist

description: Canada announced new 25% tariffs on about C$30 billion ($20.8 billion) of US-made products, including steel and aluminum, after the Trump administration went ahead with global levies on imports of those two materials.
title: Canada Strikes Back in Trade War With Tariffs on US Steel, Aluminum

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said a period of monitored “silence” on the frontline should come before the start of the 30-day truce proposed by the US.
title: Zelenskiy Says Frontline ‘Silence’ Should Precede Ceasefire

description: Slovakia doubled its exports of weapons and ammunition last year, becoming one of the most significant European arms exporters by share of gross domestic product, according to analysis conducted by one of the country’s largest commercial banks.
title: Slovakia Doubles Weapons, Ammunition Exports in 2024, CSOB Says

description: National Treasury increases government’s gross borrowing requirement for the 2025-26 fiscal year to 582 billion rand, compared with 579 billion rand forecast in 2024, according to budget review published on Wednesday.
title: South African Borrowing Requirement Edges Up; Eskom Transfer Cut

description: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana cut spending and adjusted the tax mix in a revised budget that was presented to lawmakers on Wednesday, three weeks after the nation’s coalition government rejected his initial plan.
title: Winners and Losers in South Africa’s Reworked Budget

description: South Africa’s finance minister proposed scaling back tax increases and curbing spending in a bid to resolve a standoff over the budget in the nation’s fractious governing alliance.
title: South Africa Proposes Smaller VAT Hike to End Budget Impasse

description: Romania’s far-right is scrambling to field new candidates after the independent front-runner it supported was barred from May’s presidential election.
title: Romania Far-Right Seeks a Last-Minute Presidential Candidate

description: China said it has forcefully cracked down on the fentanyl trade and condemned President Donald Trump’s tariffs, as the world’s two largest economies remain at odds over the conditions for any talks to cool tensions.
title: China Says US Owes ‘Big Thank You’ on Fentanyl, Urges Talks

description: China said it would host nuclear talks with Iran and Russia, days after US President Donald Trump urged Tehran to negotiate a new deal over its atomic work or face military action.
title: China to Host Iran Nuclear Talks as Trump Sends Letter to Tehran

description: Opposition parties in Singapore called into question revisions to the electoral boundaries, accusing officials of “gerrymandering” ahead of a critical vote only months away.
title: Singapore’s Opposition Claim ‘Gerrymandering’ Ahead of Election

description: Polish prosecutors charged a Belarusian citizen with espionage and sabotage for allegedly setting fire to a large construction supermarket in Warsaw on behalf of Russia’s intelligence services.
title: Poland Charges Belarusian Citizen for Alleged Arson in Warsaw

description: Zimbabwe is grappling with the worst outbreak of African armyworms in two decades, with the pest having already spread across the whole country, the government said.
title: Zimbabwe Suffers Worst Outbreak of African Armyworm in 20 Years

description: Australian climate activist and financier Simon Holmes a Court has called on voters frustrated by major parties to support independent lawmakers at the forthcoming election, giving them more influence in a potential hung parliament.
title: Australian Climate Financier Urges Voters to Back Independents

description: Pakistani security forces killed at least 27 people in an exchange of gunfire with insurgents who have been holding a train since Tuesday in southwestern Balochistan province thought to have had hundreds aboard.
title: Pakistan Army Kills 27 Militants as Hundreds Still Held on Train

description: China summoned Walmart Inc. executives on Tuesday to express its concern after the US retailer reportedly urged its Chinese suppliers to absorb increased American trade tariffs by lowering prices.
title: China Summons Walmart After Report of Price-Cut Demand

description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte’s arrest over his deadly drug war is adding to political risk that could prompt companies to weigh plans to raise capital, according to the investment banking unit of the country’s top lender.
title: Top Philippine Investment Bank Nervous as Political Risk Rises

description: The European Union launched countermeasures on Wednesday against new US metals tariffs, with plans to impose its own duties on €26 billion ($28.3 billion) worth of American goods.
title: EU Targets €26 Billion of US Products in Tariff Retaliation

description: The Baltic country hopes to turn its thriving tech sector into a military-industrial complex, and tap into rising European defense spending.
title: Estonian Startups See Opportunity in Europe’s Rush to Rearm

description: President Donald Trump latest tariffs on steel and aluminum imports came into force Wednesday, extending his trade wars to more of the US’s top trading partners in a risky bid to revive an industrial base that migrated over decades to foreign competitors.
title: Trump Tariffs on Steel, Aluminum Take Effect With No Exemptions

description: Therapeutic drugs should be “intensively” tested on US poultry flocks infected with bird flu, Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said, arguing that the medications could help identify treatments for human cases.
title: Health Secretary RFK Jr. Calls for Intensive Testing of Bird Flu Drugs on Poultry

description: Billionaire investor Ray Dalio invoked 1930s Germany to illustrate his concerns about the global implications of the current trade war, while highlighting how countries that are neutral will fare well during such conflicts.
title: Ray Dalio Cites 1930s Germany to Assess Unfolding Trade War

description: The Environmental Protection Agency said it’s terminating $20 billion in grants awarded through a green bank program established under former President Joe Biden’s signature climate law.
title: EPA Terminates $20 Billion in Grants for Climate Projects

description: World leaders from New Delhi to Brussels facing tariffs from President Donald Trump’s administration are watching Canada to get a preview of what happens when you hit back.
title: World Facing Trump’s Tariffs Watches Canada Test Ways of Fighting Back

description: North Korea denounced joint military drills between the US and South Korea saying the South Korean Air Force’s recent bombing mistake shows the risk of the region unintentionally getting dragged into a new armed conflict.
title: North Korea Warns of Accidental Clash Citing Recent Bomb Blunder

description: The Greenlandic party seeking the fastest breakup with Denmark stands to gain a major boost, according to early counting of the votes in the parliamentary elections that have been overshadowed by Donald Trump’s plans to take over the Arctic Island.
title: Greenland’s Independence Party Gets Boost in Early Vote Count

description: Half a million more people in England and Wales are claiming disability benefits for mental-health problems than before the pandemic, according to research that may add to concerns over government plans to squeeze welfare spending.
title: UK’s Mental Health Crisis Drives 500,000 Onto Benefits, IFS Says

description: South Africa’s finance minister will make a second attempt at presenting an acceptable budget to a fractious coalition government, raising questions about future investment in the country if it doesn’t pass.
title: South Africa’s Fractious Coalition Faces Second Budget Reckoning
